channel.title: Adobe Photoshop Element
channel.description: Turns out my friend had an extra copy and gave it to me. If I use it on the family desktop (windows XP), can i also use and register it on my personal (windows 7) laptop.

item.title: Adobe Photoshop Element
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

My school blocks .executables since I fucked up their network, However you guys are lucky we use some fucking shitty gay flash thingy gay fuck shit dick tit to edit pictures and we get blocked if the teacher sees us using it (lol).
Also my batch files are blocked, i made my self an local admin and uninstalled windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Adobe Photoshop Element
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote="`Aaron, post:13, topic:364253"][quote author=whip of soulz link=topic=460479.msg3369317#msg3369317 date=1287094354]

Elements is ew, old school used to have it, it’s like a kiddy program, all colourful icons etc, I refused to use it so I brought in PS CS4 portable, until the school threatened me with a half a million pound fine, I was permanently banned.

That’s atrocious.

You simply want to use your own software that you have brought from your residence and the school threatens a £500,000 fine. Under what grounds can they fine you for £500,000?
[/quote]I’m guessing he didn’t buy the software and got it from a torrent or something?

How would they know that exactly? most teachers are computer illiterate.[/quote]

Well, I did get it from a torrent, but technically, I never activated it in school, I only used a trial version, which was the shittest thing.
And, the computer technicians detect any application that’s opened, used to be well harsh.

Read full topic

item.title: Adobe Photoshop Element
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:17, topic:364253”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=460479.msg3369145#msg3369145 date=1287084295]
Elements is ew, old school used to have it, it’s like a kiddy program, all colourful icons etc, I refused to use it so I brought in PS CS4 portable, until the school threatened me with a half a million pound fine, I was permanently banned.
[/quote]
My school used elements last year, elements 7 wasnt that bad but i hear this year we have the only room with windows 7 and we’re using CS5. It was just mainly geared towards photography editing instead of straight up drawing like CS#.[/quote]

woah, haven’t seen you post in a long time. Hai!

Read full topic

item.title: Adobe Photoshop Element

item.description:

Elements is ew, old school used to have it, it’s like a kiddy program, all colourful icons etc, I refused to use it so I brought in PS CS4 portable, until the school threatened me with a half a million pound fine, I was permanently banned.

My school used elements last year, elements 7 wasnt that bad but i hear this year we have the only room with windows 7 and we’re using CS5. It was just mainly geared towards photography editing instead of straight up drawing like CS#.

item.title: Adobe Photoshop Element
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:7, topic:364253”][quote author=Primadude link=topic=460479.msg3369045#msg3369045 date=1287068841]

Would I need a keygen for a new code if i used it on a different computer after registering it on this one.

CS4 or CS5? If it’s CS4 I have a keygen that provides serial numbers for all of the CS4 products.
[/quote]

He said Photoshop Elements, it’s not in any creative suite.[/quote]

It’s within a CS4 keygen I have so I assumed it was within CS4, didn’t actually know if it was or not :P.

Read full topic
